definitions: legal process of taking another's child and bringing up as one's own
action of choosing to take up or follow an idea method or practice
examples: Their adoption of the baby was finalized after months of paperwork
International adoption requires meeting requirements of both countries involved
The adoption of new technology improved productivity significantly
Widespread adoption of electric vehicles depends on infrastructure development

definitions: place of burial for a dead body typically marked by stone
giving cause for alarm or requiring serious thought
examples: Fresh flowers adorned her grandmother's grave every week
The old cemetery contained graves dating back centuries
The situation is grave and requires immediate action
He spoke in grave tones about the diagnosis

definitions: thick strong cord made by twisting together strands of hemp or wire
length of material used for tying binding or hanging
examples: Climbers always check their rope before ascending the mountain
The boat was secured to the dock with rope
Give him enough rope and he'll hang himself eventually
Jump rope is excellent exercise for cardiovascular health

definitions: instance of buying or selling something or business deal
exchange or interaction between people or systems
examples: The bank processes thousands of transactions daily without error
Keep receipts for all financial transactions for tax purposes
Every database transaction must be recorded for audit purposes
The transaction between the countries improved diplomatic relations

definitions: area of short regularly mown grass in yard or park
fine sheer linen or cotton fabric
examples: He mows the lawn every Saturday morning without fail
The perfect lawn requires regular watering and fertilization
Her wedding dress was made of delicate lawn fabric
Lawn handkerchiefs were popular in Victorian times

definitions: thin sphere of liquid enclosing air or gas
temporary period of unusually high activity that cannot last
examples: Children love blowing soap bubbles in the backyard
Bubbles rose to the surface of the boiling water
The housing bubble burst causing widespread economic damage
Tech bubble of the 1990s created and destroyed fortunes

definitions: daughter of a monarch or wife of a prince
woman regarded as having characteristics of a princess
examples: The princess wore a tiara to the state dinner
Princess Diana was beloved by people worldwide
Don't act like a princess expecting everyone to serve you
Her father treated her like a princess growing up

definitions: part of trunk or large branch of tree that has fallen or been cut
official record of events during voyage of ship or aircraft
examples: We added another log to the campfire for warmth
The cabin was built from pine logs decades ago
The captain's log recorded daily weather and navigation details
Computer logs help troubleshoot system errors effectively

definitions: large piece of fabric used as covering for warmth
covering all cases or instances without exception
examples: She pulled the warm blanket up to her chin
Electric blankets help reduce heating costs in winter
The company issued a blanket denial of all allegations
Blanket statements rarely capture the full truth

definitions: sound of laughing expressing amusement or joy
person or thing that causes amusement
examples: Her infectious laugh filled the room with joy
A good laugh relieves stress and improves mood
That movie was a real laugh from start to finish
He's always good for a laugh at parties

definitions: country state or territory ruled by king or queen
each of the three divisions of natural world
examples: The kingdom prospered under the wise king's rule
Medieval kingdoms often warred over territory and resources
The animal kingdom includes all living creatures that move
Fungi belong to their own kingdom separate from plants

definitions: small insect or similar creeping or crawling invertebrate
error or defect in computer program or system
examples: A bug flew into the room through the open window
Most bugs are harmless and beneficial to gardens
The software bug caused the app to crash repeatedly
Developers spent hours trying to fix the bug

definitions: of chief importance or principal concern
preliminary election to select party candidates
examples: Safety is our primary concern during construction
The primary goal is improving student achievement
She won the primary but lost the general election
Primary elections determine each party's nominee

definitions: person proposed for an elected position or honor
person nominated for appointment to an office
examples: The party's nominee for president gave an acceptance speech
Oscar nominees are announced weeks before the ceremony
The nominee for Supreme Court faced tough questioning
Each nominee must undergo background checks

definitions: thorough or dramatic change in form or appearance
process of changing from one state to another
examples: The transformation of the neighborhood took twenty years
Her transformation from shy student to confident leader inspired others
Digital transformation revolutionized how businesses operate globally
The caterpillar's transformation into a butterfly amazes children

definitions: building devoted to worship of god or gods
flat part on either side of the head between forehead and ear
examples: The ancient temple attracted pilgrims from distant lands
Buddhist temples often feature elaborate architectural details
She massaged her temples to relieve the headache
Gray hair first appeared at his temples

definitions: action or process of arriving at a destination
person or thing that has arrived
examples: Flight arrival times are displayed on the monitors
His late arrival disrupted the meeting's agenda
The new arrivals were welcomed warmly by staff
Recent arrivals to the country faced many challenges

definitions: feeling of being upset or annoyed at inability to achieve something
prevention of the progress success or fulfillment of something
examples: His frustration grew as traffic remained motionless
Learning a new language involves periods of frustration
The frustration of their plans led to conflict
Weather caused frustration of the rescue efforts

definitions: public meeting or march protesting or supporting something
action or process of showing how something works
examples: Thousands joined the demonstration for climate action
Peaceful demonstrations are protected by law
The chef gave a demonstration of knife skills
Product demonstrations help customers understand features

definitions: presence in environment of substances having harmful or poisonous effects
action of polluting or state of being polluted
examples: Air pollution causes respiratory problems in urban areas
Industrial pollution threatens marine ecosystems worldwide
Noise pollution affects quality of life in cities
Light pollution prevents stargazing in populated areas

definitions: large printed picture or notice for display
person who posts messages online
examples: Movie posters decorated the teenager's bedroom walls
Campaign posters appeared throughout the city
The original poster clarified their comment later
Anonymous posters can spread misinformation online

definitions: small metal spike with broadened flat head driven into wood
horny covering on upper surface of tip of finger or toe
examples: He hammered the nail into the wall carefully
Rusty nails can cause tetanus if they pierce skin
She painted her nails bright red for the party
Biting nails is a common nervous habit

definitions: loud inarticulate shout or scream expressing emotion
spell of shedding tears
examples: A cry for help came from the burning building
The baby's cry woke everyone in the house
She had a good cry after the sad movie
Sometimes you need a cry to release emotions

definitions: advice or information aimed at resolving a problem
process of guiding or being guided
examples: Career guidance helps students choose appropriate paths
The manual provides guidance for software installation
Under her guidance the team exceeded all goals
Parental guidance shapes children's values and behavior

definitions: instrument for writing or drawing with ink
small enclosure for farm animals
examples: She signed the contract with a blue pen
Digital pens can convert handwriting to text
The sheep were kept in a pen overnight
Move the pigs to the larger pen

definitions: yellow oval citrus fruit with thick skin and acidic juice
person or thing that proves to be defective or unsatisfactory
examples: Add lemon juice to prevent the apples from browning
The recipe calls for zest of one lemon
That car turned out to be a real lemon
The law protects consumers who buy lemons

definitions: legal status of person or entity that cannot repay debts
complete lack of a particular quality or value
examples: The company filed for bankruptcy protection last month
Personal bankruptcy affects credit scores for years
The moral bankruptcy of the regime became evident
Intellectual bankruptcy leads to recycled ideas

definitions: instance of invading a country with armed force
unwelcome intrusion into another's domain
examples: The invasion began at dawn with air strikes
Historical invasions shaped modern national boundaries
Tourists complained about the invasion of their privacy
The invasive species invasion threatens native plants

definitions: person or thing that takes place of another
action of replacing someone or something
examples: The replacement part arrived within two days
Finding a replacement for her will be difficult
Hip replacement surgery improved his mobility dramatically
The replacement of old pipes prevented future leaks

definitions: general agreement among a group of people
generally accepted opinion or decision among a group
examples: The committee reached consensus after hours of discussion
Scientific consensus supports climate change theories
Building consensus requires listening to all viewpoints
There's no consensus on the best approach yet

definitions: touch with the lips as sign of love or greeting
gentle or light touch
examples: Their first kiss happened under the stars
A kiss on the cheek is a common greeting
The ball gave the rim a kiss before dropping in
Waves kiss the shore with gentle rhythm

definitions: relating to France its people or language
style of cooking or cultural element from France
examples: She studied French in high school and college
French culture values food and conversation highly
French fries aren't actually from France originally
The restaurant serves classic French cuisine

definitions: physical components of a computer system
tools and equipment made of metal
examples: The hardware upgrade improved computer performance significantly
Hardware failures can cause data loss
The hardware store sells tools and building supplies
Brass hardware gives furniture an elegant look

definitions: steel bar forming part of railroad track
railroad as a means of transport
examples: Workers replaced damaged rail sections overnight
The train jumped the rails causing delays
Shipping by rail costs less than trucking
High-speed rail connects major cities efficiently

definitions: low temperature especially in the atmosphere
common viral infection affecting the nose and throat
examples: The cold made her fingers numb within minutes
Cold weather requires proper clothing and heating
She caught a cold from her coworker
Rest and fluids help recover from colds

definitions: friend or companion especially at work
either member of a breeding pair of animals
examples: His work mates threw him a retirement party
G'day mate is a common Australian greeting
Wolves choose one mate for life typically
The zoo hopes the pandas will mate successfully

definitions: small wooden shelter or house in a wild or remote area
private room or compartment on a ship
examples: They spent weekends at their mountain cabin
The log cabin had no electricity or running water
Passengers returned to their cabins after dinner
The captain's cabin contained navigation equipment

definitions: activity of eating a meal especially in a restaurant
relating to a room or area where meals are eaten
examples: Fine dining requires reservations weeks in advance
Outdoor dining became popular during the pandemic
The dining room seats twelve people comfortably
They converted the dining area into a home office

definitions: person of liberal political views supporting individual rights
person who is open-minded or not strict
examples: Liberals generally support social welfare programs
The liberal candidate won in urban districts
He's liberal with praise but stingy with criticism
Take a liberal amount of sunscreen to the beach

definitions: long limbless reptile with no eyelids
treacherous or deceitful person
examples: The snake slithered silently through the grass
Venomous snakes require careful handling
Don't trust him because he's a real snake
That snake stole my idea and claimed credit

definitions: plant grown for its leaves which are dried for smoking
prepared leaves used in cigarettes cigars or pipes
examples: Tobacco farming was the region's main industry historically
The tobacco plant contains nicotine naturally
Tobacco use causes various health problems
Many countries heavily tax tobacco products

definitions: determination of relative position of something
process of orienting someone to new situation
examples: The map's orientation confused hikers initially
Screen orientation changes when you rotate the device
New employee orientation lasts three days
College orientation helps freshmen adjust to campus life

definitions: information or resources put into a system or process
data fed into a computer or electronic system
examples: We need input from all departments before deciding
Her input during meetings is always valuable
Check the input before running the program
Voice input makes typing unnecessary

definitions: organization or person that competes against others
person who takes part in a sporting contest
examples: Our main competitor launched a new product line
Studying competitors helps improve business strategy
All competitors must register before the race
The youngest competitor was only twelve years old

definitions: student in first year of high school or college
person new to a situation or activity
examples: Freshman orientation helps new students adjust to college
The freshman class elected representatives last week
As a freshman senator she's still learning procedures
Don't expect perfection from a freshman employee

definitions: gift of money or goods to charity or cause
act of giving something voluntarily
examples: Tax-deductible donations support the museum's programs
The charity relies on donations from generous supporters
Blood donation saves lives every single day
Organ donation requires family consent in many places

definitions: person who gives money or goods to charity
person who provides blood organs or other biological materials
examples: Anonymous donors funded the new hospital wing
Major donors receive special recognition at events
The kidney donor saved her brother's life
Blood donors must meet health requirements

definitions: large bowl for urination and defecation typically with water flush
process of washing and grooming oneself
examples: The toilet needs repair because it keeps running
Public toilets should be kept clean always
Her morning toilet takes at least an hour
Victorian ladies' toilet involved elaborate grooming rituals

definitions: system of ideas and ideals forming basis of theory or policy
set of beliefs characteristic of a group or individual
examples: Political ideology shapes voting patterns significantly
Competing ideologies led to the cold war
Corporate ideology influences company culture and decisions
His ideology prevents compromise on certain issues

definitions: magnificence or great beauty
high renown or honor won by notable achievements
examples: The sunset's glory took everyone's breath away
Autumn leaves display nature's glory brilliantly
Olympic glory motivates athletes through grueling training
The team's glory days are long past now
